DataElement.preferredName: Bioelectrical Impedance Dual X-ray Absorptometry Total Body Mass Measurement Weight Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric response that represents the total body mass content using a Dual X-ray Absorptometry measured in grams.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bioelectrical Impedance Dual X-ray Absorptometry Total Body Mass Measurement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Measurement of total body mass as determined by either dual xray absorptometry or bioelectrical impedence.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Dual X-ray Absorptiometry Bioelectric Impedance Analysis Total Body Mass
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique for scanning bone and measuring bone mineral density (BMD). A DXA scanner produces 2 X-ray beams, each with different energy levels. One beam is high energy while the other is low energy. The amount of x-rays that pass through the bone is measured for each beam. This will vary depending on the thickness of the bone. Based on the difference between the 2 beams, the bone density can be measured.:A method to assess body composition, i.e., the relative percentages of body weight comprised of fat tissue and lean body mass.  It is based on the principle that the resistance to an applied electric current is inversely related to the amount of lean body mass within the body. Impedance is greatest in fat tissue, which contains only 10-20% water, while lean body mass, which contains 70-75% water, allows the signal to pass much more easily.:Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:The entire physical structure of an organism.  It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.:The amount of matter in an object.

Concepts.definition: A technique for scanning bone and measuring bone mineral density (BMD). A DXA scanner produces 2 X-ray beams, each with different energy levels. One beam is high energy while the other is low energy. The amount of x-rays that pass through the bone is measured for each beam. This will vary depending on the thickness of the bone. Based on the difference between the 2 beams, the bone density can be measured.

A method to assess body composition, i.e., the relative percentages of body weight comprised of fat tissue and lean body mass.  It is based on the principle that the resistance to an applied electric current is inversely related to the amount of lean body mass within the body. Impedance is greatest in fat tissue, which contains only 10-20% water, while lean body mass, which contains 70-75% water, allows the signal to pass much more easily.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.
The amount of matter in an object.

Property.preferredDefinition: Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

Concepts.definition: Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: DCI CRF:  Duke Cancer Institute Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The numerical result of the determination of the vertical force exerted by the mass of an individual as a result of gravity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
